cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana/Mississippi coast) early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near southeastern Louisiana or southern Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches extend from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the AL/FL border and adjacent bays/lakes.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and northeastern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle; inland areas of MS, AL and western FL Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible mid- to late week as remnants pass inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal Georgia late this week, but widespread flooding is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along the southeast U.S. beaches during the coming week.
